div.l: By god qduod Iohn Symkyn nede has no pere
Hym by hoves ʆserue him selfe þat hath no swayn̄
Or elles he is a fole as clerkys seyn
Oure Manciple y hope he wol be dede
So worcheth ay þe swymes in his hede
And for þi is I com and eke aleyn̄
To grynde oure corn̄ and cary mele agayn̄
I prey you spede vs hens what ye may
It shal be doun qduod symkym by my fey
What wol ye don while it is in honde
By god right by þe hoper wol I stonde
Qduod Iohn and se how þe corn̄ gos In
Yit saugh I never by my fader kyn̄
How þat þe hoper wagges til and fro
Aleyn answered Iohn wiltow so
Þen wol I be by nethe by my crowne
And se how þat þe mele falleth a downe
Intil þe trough þat shal be my disport
For Iohn in feyth y may ben of youre sorte
I am as evel a Miller as ben ye
Þis miller smyled of her nycetee
And thought al þis nys doun̄ but for a wile
Þey wene þat no man may hem by gile
But by my thrifte yet shal y blere her ye
For al þe sleight in hur philosophie
The more queynte crekes þat þey make
Þe more wol y stele whan y take
In stede of floure yet y wol yeve hem brann̄
Þe grettest clerkys byn not wysest men
As whilom þus to þe wolfe spake þe mare
Of al hir art cowde y noght a tare
Oute atte dore he goth ful prively
When þat he say his tyme ꝓproprely
He loketh vp and down til he hath founde
Þe clerkes hors þer as it stode y bounde
By hinde þe Mille vnder a lefesle
And to þe hors he goth him feire and wel
And strepeth of þe bridel right anon
And whan þe hors was loose he begynneþ to gon̄
Towarde þe fenne þer wildmarys renne
